title: What is the English translation of 'भगवान उसकी आत्मा को शांति दे’? - Quora

response.answer_text: Google Translate from Hindi gives May his soul rest in peace, which seems trustworthy to me. Let me do a word-by-word analysis to check this: भगवान | Bhag’vān’, “God the Almighty”;उसकी | us’kī, fem. sg. of “uskā”, “his/her/its”;आत्मा | ātmā, “soul”, fem. sg.;को | kī, fem. sg. possessive particle (=«’s»);शांति | śānti, “peace”, fem. sg.;दे | de, various forms of “dena”, “give”, including the subjunctive present third person singular.So «May God the Almighty give the peace of his/her/its soul», i.e. «May his/her/its soul rest in the peace of God». So Google wasn’t too far off.
A general translation would be ‘May his/her soul rest in Peace’ - RIP Literal translation is ‘May God rest his/her soul’.
